column5: The month of July has blown by me.  Twenty days working in the sun on the St. Mary's River with a handful of evening walleye trips and all of a sudden it's the August long weekend.  With some days off, and a few household chores taken care of, I was headed out of the Soo around 9 am Friday morning.  We parked the car, carried a gear down to the lake, and piled it in to the 10 ft. jon boat.  The first pass of a productive shoreline yielded a bunch of quality fish.  We got 6 fish between 2-5lbs, all of which were swimming in the shallows.  The fish were feeding so aggressively that we were able to sight-fish groups of 4-5 large bass and hone in on them until we put at least one of them in the boat.  Strikes on follow ups were likely.  At this point we begun to realize that we were in for a special day.  Having left the camera in the truck, we reluctantly went back to the landing and fetched the digital.  As my cousin returned from the vehicle I hooked into the first nice fish on film of the day, right from the landing.    As we worked our way out to the edge of the weed flats we were picked back up right where we left off.       Fish throughout the day came in all shapes and sizes.            And a bonus pike!    By far it was the wildest day of bassin' I've ever had.  Thanks for checkin' out the pics!
Nice report, possibley a name change is in order .... Dr Micropterus dolomieu .  tight lines mb
wow that is one heck of a day bassin!  Cheers!
WOW! Talk about spoiled fishermen! That is some amazing fishing you have up there! Those are some nice smallies!
That is a lot of nice bass, good shootin.....er, I mean fishin.
Wow, Doc those are some impressive bass. Just all around great looking fish!    TDunn
Great report and what an impressive photo stringer!
Great day of bassin!  Fishing's always fun but when you are hammering those pigs it's awesome!
